maml:description.maml:para: Connect and receive a Access Token to SalesForce.
This script will login to SalesForce, and return a Access token you can use to send API requests to SalesForce API.
In order to use it, you must include 'Authorization: Bearer access_token' as a header in your request.
For simplicity, you can pass the returned object to Invoke-APSalesForceRestMethod as a variable,
and it will automatically be parsed to the correct settings.

maml:Description.maml:para: Base URI to SalesForce domain, for example http://my.salesforce.com
Credential object to use when logging in to SalesForce
SalesForce Client_secret, also refered to as Consumer Secret
SalesForce Client_Id, also refered to as Consumer Key or User Key
OAuth GrantType, must be Password for username / password authentication.
Base URI to SalesForce domain, for example http://my.salesforce.com
Credential object to use when logging in to SalesForce
SalesForce Client_secret, also refered to as Consumer Secret
SalesForce Client_Id, also refered to as Consumer Key or User Key
OAuth GrantType, must be Password for username / password authentication.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will return a PSCustomObject containing access_token : your access token instance_url : base URI to your salesforce connection id : your userID token_type : type of token aquired issued_at : Signature created in no of seconds since Unix Epoch signature : Base64 encoded token validation

maml:description.maml:para: This command searches for a profile in SalesForce.
This command will create a hashtable that can be used to search for one or more profiles in SalesForce.
If an AccessToken is passed it will automatically try to invoke the search query,
and return any object found.
If no AccessToken is found, it will return the hashtable containing the search endpoint and the method to use.

maml:Description.maml:para: Minimum three characters. Accepts wildcard (* or ?) with a minimum of two characters.
Override the default SalesForce API Version (v41.0)
Override the default SalesForce API Version (v41.0)
Minimum three characters. Accepts wildcard (* or ?) with a minimum of two characters.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS> Get-APSalesForceProfile -SearchString '*m*a*'
Name Value ---- ----- Method Get Endpoint /services/data/v41.0/parameterizedSearch/?q=*m*a*&sobject=Profile&Profile.field...

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will return a hashtable containing searchquery and method.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS> Get-APSalesForceProfile -SearchString 'a*b?c' -EndpointVersion 'v42.0' -Properties Description,Id,name
Name Value ---- ----- Method Get Endpoint /services/data/v42.0/parameterizedSearch/?q=a*b?c&sobject=Profile&Profile.fields=Description,Id,name

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will return a searchquery using a differend endpoint version, and custom properties to return
This command will perform a search and return any results.
If search fails it will return the hashtable used to invoke the search.## PARAMETERS

maml:description.maml:para: This command searches for a user in SalesForce.
This command will create a hashtable that can be used to search for a user in SalesForce.
If an AccessToken is passed it will automatically try to invoke the search query,
and return any object found.
If no AccessToken is found, it will return th ehashtable containing the search endpoint and the method to use.

maml:Description.maml:para: Minimum three characters. Accepts wildcard (* or ?) with a minimum of two characters.
Override the default SalesForce API Version (v41.0)
Minimum three characters. Accepts wildcard (* or ?) with a minimum of two characters.
Override the default SalesForce API Version (v41.0)

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS> Get-APSalesForceUser -SearchString 'username'
Name Value ---- ----- Method Get Endpoint /services/data/v41.0/search/?q=FIND+{username}+IN+name+FIELDS+RETURNING+USER(Id,Phon...

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will return a hashtable containing searchquery and method.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS> Get-APSalesForceUser -SearchString 'username' -EndpointVersion 'v42.0' -Properties Id,CompanyName,Division | ft -AutoSize
Name Value ---- ----- Method Get Endpoint /services/data/v42.0/search/?q=FIND+{username}+IN+name+FIELDS+RETURNING+USER(Id,CompanyName,Division)

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will return a searchquery using a differend endpoint version, and custom properties to return
This command will perform a search and return any results.
If search fails it will return the hashtable used to invoke the search.

maml:description.maml:para: Calls the SalesForce API with added parsing of access token
This finction makes a call to the SalesForce API using Invoke-WebRequest.
It automatically parses the passed on Access Token to use correct URI and Token headers. It also tries to make sure you always send and receive objects as Json.

maml:Description.maml:para: Path to endpoint in SalesForce API, for example '/services/data/v40.0/sobjects/user/'
Base URI to your SalesForce domain.
Only needed if it is different from AccessToken instance_url
Body to send if method is put or post
Path to endpoint in SalesForce API, for example '/services/data/v40.0/sobjects/user/'
Base URI to your SalesForce domain.
Only needed if it is different from AccessToken instance_url
Body to send if method is put or post

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will call the User endpoint using the URI and access tokens from $SalesForceToken.
If any result is given it will be sent back to the pipeline.
This command will post the pscustomobject to the user endpoint using the URI and access tokens from $SalesForceToken.
It will automatically convert the PSCustomObject to json format before sending it.
This command will post the pscustomobject to the user endpoint using access tokens from $SalesForceToken.
It will use the base SalesForce URI 'https://my.other.salesforce.com'.
It will automatically convert the PSCustomObject to json format before sending it.
This command will post the already json formated body to the user endpoint using the URI and access tokens from $SalesForceToken.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a SalesForce user object to use when creating new user
This CmdLet will create a User hashtable containing user settings, endpoint data and method,
To be used together with Invoke-APSalesForceRestMethod to create a new user in SalesForce.
If a SalesForce access token is sent to this CmdLet it will try to add the user using Invoke-APSalesForceRestMethod,
and if it fails to add it, it will return the hashtable to be used.
If no SalesForce access token is sent to this CmdLet it will retrun the hashtable directly.

maml:Description.maml:para: Override the default SalesForce API Version (v41.0)
Community nickname, displayed in SalesForce online communities.
Community nickname, displayed in SalesForce online communities.
Override the default SalesForce API Version (v41.0)

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will return a hashtable containing user settings as stated, default (v41) endpoint,
and method (Post)
Theese commands will create and add the user to the SalesForcePlattform
This command will create and try to add the user to the SalesForcePlattform
